title: Ticket #554: schedd evicts thousands of jobs unexpectedly.
description:
For unknown reasons the schedd gets a SIGQUIT and evicts thousands of jobs.

Then the restart of the schedd has many of these lines in it: 

5/5 19:46:07 (pid:30764) OwnerCheck(vedovato) failed in SetAttribute for job 31328.28921

Would it be possible for a scheddlog or masterlog to exactly specify who sent it the SIGQUIT so it could be tracked to a human or procedural source?

See ticket for details.
remarks:
Abandoning for now. Carsten is thinking we will revisit this once the site upgrades to the latest stable version and also updating to Debian Lenny

[update 2012-01-23 by pfc: changing status from Abandoned to Resolved so this issue stops showing up in my list of unresolved tickets. If it's still an issue (Carsten), we should properly reopen it at the appropriate priority.]
creator: psilord
